text: The Bucharest Wolves (also known as Lupii București in Romania) was a professional Romanian rugby union team based in Bucharest that competed annually in the European Rugby Challenge Cup competition. The team that was formed every season to play in the Challenge Cup consisted of rugby players playing in the domestic Romanian leagues. The team had never made it past the pool stages in the European Rugby Challenge Cup but have made some upsets against the likes of RC Toulonnais, Rugby Calvisano and Crociati Parma Rugby FC. Starting with 2015, the franchise was to replaced by the winner CEC Bank Superliga to compete in the European Rugby Challenge Cup. ==Former squad== *note – Players in bold have played at least one match for their national team. ==Statistics== * 2004–05 European Shield – played 2, won 1, lost 1. * 2005–06 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 1, lost 5. * 2006–07 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 1, lost 5. * 2007–08 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 2, drew 1, lost 3. * 2008–09 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 1, lost 5. * 2009–10 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 1, lost 5. * 2010–11 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 1, lost 5. * 2011–12 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 2, lost 4. * 2012–13 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 2, lost 4. * 2013–14 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 2, lost 4. * 2014–15 European Challenge Cup pool stage – played 6, won 0, lost 6. * Overall Record – played 56, won 14, drew 1, lost 41. ==See also== * Romania national rugby union team * Rugby union in Romania ==External links== * Bucureşti Rugby on ercrugby.com * Federația Română de Rugby * Rugby Romania * PlanetaOvala.ro – Romanian Rugby News Category:Sport in Bucharest Category:Romanian rugby union teams Category:Rugby clubs established in 2004 Category:European Rugby Challenge Cup Category:2004 establishments in Romania
title: București Wolves
